info.description:
Endpoints labeled open do not require authentication. The protected endpoints on the other hand, do require
authentication. I'm not sure how long the jwt token should last. I'm thinking we should set the expire on
that token to be super short - like 5 minutes (upto an hour maybe?) to minimize the amount of time an
attacker can use that token. The refresh token will last longer - currently 7 days. If you make a request
to a protected endpoint using a "Refresh" token in your request headers, you will receive a new
authorization token (set-authorization) and refresh token (set-refresh) in the response headers when
you make a request with an expired authorization token. You MUST replace both tokens in your request headers
to stay authenticated. The old refresh token gets replaced on the backend therefore, you need to use the
new refresh token to remain actively logged in.
info.title: FOMO API

get.description: Returns all balances for user. Use optional query param 'symbol' as lowercase ticker symbol - e.g. ada.

200.description: "data" will contain array of balances with "status": "success"

500.description: the message will state what the internal server error was with "status": "error"

get.description: Returns a list of registered devices for logged in user.

200.description: "data" will contain array of devices with "status": "success"

500.description: the message will state what the internal server error was with "status": "error"

post.description: Registers a new device for a user so they may receive push notifications.

200.description: "data" will be non null with "status": "success"

500.description: the message will state what the internal server error was with "status": "error"

get.description: Get a user's device by the device's ID.

200.description: "data" will contain device stuffs with "status": "success"

500.description: the message will state what the internal server error was with "status": "error"

200.description: "data" will contain updated device info with "status": "success"

500.description: the message will state what the internal server error was with "status": "error"

200.description: data will be null with "status": "success"

500.description: the message will state what the internal server error was with "status": "error"

get.description: Get all the user keys for this user. The api secrets will not be returned in the response data.

200.description: "data" will contain a list of key info with "status": "success"

500.description: the message will state what the internal server error was with "status": "error"

post.description: Associate a new exchange api key to a user's account. Secrets will not be returned in response data.

200.description: "data" will contain key info with "status": "success"

500.description: the message will state what the internal server error was with "status": "error"

get.description: Gets a user's key by the key ID. The secret will not be returned in the response data.

200.description: "data" will contain key stuffs with "status": "success"

500.description: the message will state what the internal server error was with "status": "error"

put.description: The user can only update the description of an added key. The secret will not be returned.

200.description: "data" will contain key info with "status": "success"

500.description: the message will state what the internal server error was with "status": "error"

delete.description: This will remove the api key from the system.

200.description: data will be null with "status": "success"

500.description: the message will state what the internal server error was with "status": "error"

post.description:
The login endpoint returns an authorization token in the "set-authorization" response header.
You may also receive an optional refresh token if you include 'remember': true in your post request.
Both tokens will be returned in the reponse headers as "set-refresh" and "set-authorization".

parameters.description: Required. Backend code does not check email atm.
parameters.name: email

parameters.description: Required. Backend code does not have any password requirements atm.
parameters.name: password

parameters.description: Optional. Return refresh token in response
parameters.name: remember

200.description: "data" will be non null with "status": "success"

400.description: email and password are not found in request with "status": "fail"

401.description: unauthorized user because of incorrect password with "status": "fail"

500.description: the message will state what the internal server error was with "status": "error"

get.description:
If a valid refresh token is found in the request headers, the server
will attempt to remove the refresh token from the database.

200.description: data will be null with status "success"

400.description: you either sent in no refresh token or the refresh token in the header is not valid with status: "fail"

200.description: "data" will contain array of notifications with "status": "success"

get.description:
Returns a summary of plans. The plan orders will not be returned and will be null.
Query Params: status, marketName, exchange, page, pageSize

The defaults for the params are:
status - active
page - 0
pageSize - 50

example: /plans?exchange=binance

200.description: "data" will contain an array of plan summaries

500.description: the message will state what the internal server error was with "status": "error"

post.description: This will create a new chain of orders for the user. All orders are encapsulated within a plan.

parameters.description: Optional defaults to 'active' status. Valid input status is 'active', 'inactive', or 'historic'
parameters.name: status

parameters.description: Required bool to indicate that you want the plan to be 'closed' when the last order for the plan finishes (note: order status fail will also close the plan)
parameters.name: closeOnComplete

parameters.description: Required array of orders. The structure of the order tree will be dictated by the parentOrderID. All orders following the root order must have a parentOrderID. The root order must have a parentOrderID of "00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000". Use grupo (aka spanish for group) to assign a group label to orders.
parameters.name: orders

200.description: "data" will contain paged orders

500.description: the message will state what the internal server error was with "status": "error"

get.description:
Returns a plan with completd currency and base currency names. There is no limit on planned orders - these are the
orders that belong to a trade plan. Therefore, the response data will contain a paged structure for the plan orders.

example: /plans/:some_plan_id?page0&pageSize=50

200.description: "data" will contain paged orders

500.description: the message will state what the internal server error was with "status": "error"

put.description: You must send in the entire inactive chain that you want updated in a single call. Send in all orders that need to be updated, deleted, or added.

parameters.description: Optional only needed to update the status of the plan to 'inactive', 'active'
parameters.name: status

parameters.description: Optional bool to indicate that you want the plan to be 'closed' when the last order for the plan finishes (note: order status fail will also close the plan)
parameters.name: closeOnComplete

parameters.description: Required array of orders. You cannot update executed orders. The entire inactive chain is assumed to be in this array.
parameters.name: orders

500.description: the message will state what the internal server error was with "status": "error" "data" will contain order info with "status": "success"

delete.description:
You may delete a plan if it has not executed. That is, the plan has no filled orders. Delete plan becomes cancel plan
when an order has been filled. In theory, this should kill all active orders for a plan and set the status for the plan
as 'aborted'. Once a plan has been 'aborted' you cannot update or restart that plan.

200.description: "data" will contain plan summary with null orders.

500.description: the message will state what the internal server error was with "status": "error"

get.description: Returns a list of active markets.

200.description: "data" will contain array of markets with "status": "success"

get.description:
Creates a new session for an authenticated user. The session data will eventually contain
whatever info you need to begin a new session. At the moment the response data mirrors
login data. This endpoint depends on the user-service. If the user-service
is unreachable, a 410 with a status of "error" will be returned.
get.summary: create a new session for a user (protected)

200.description: data will be non null with status "success"

410.description: the user-service is unreachable with status "error"

post.description:
Registers a new user. Expects email to be unique. Duplicate email will result
in a bad request.

parameters.description: Required. Must be unique! We need to validate these coming in.
parameters.name: email

200.description: "data" will be non null with "status": "success"

400.description: message should relay information with regard to bad request with "status": "fail"

410.description: the user-service is not reachable. The user-service is a microservice that runs independantly from the api. When we take it offline you will receive this error.

500.description: the message will state what the internal server error was with "status": "error"

put.description:
You can change the user's first, last, or email. Note we need to implement a secure method of
verifing the user's new email. This has yet to be implemented.

parameters.description: Optional. Note: we need to validate these!
parameters.name: email

200.description: "data" will contain updated user data with "status": "success"

400.description: message in badrequest should be descriptive with "status": "fail"

401.description: unauthorized user because of incorrect url param with "status": "fail"

410.description: the user-service is unreachable with status "error"

500.description: the message will state what the internal server error was with "status": "error"

put.description: Allows an authenticated user to change their password. The url param is the user's id.

200.description: the status will be "success" with data null.

400.description: you did something wrong here with status "fail". Hopefully, the message is descriptive enough.

401.description: the user ID in url param does not match with status "fail".

410.description: the user-service is unreachable with status "error"

500.description: the message will state what the internal server error was with "status": "error"

DB.description:
The sql package creates and frees connections automatically; it
also maintains a free pool of idle connections. If the database has
a concept of per-connection state, such state can only be reliably
observed within a transaction. Once DB.Begin is called, the
returned Tx is bound to a single connection. Once Commit or
Rollback is called on the transaction, that transaction's
connection is returned to DB's idle connection pool. The pool size
can be controlled with SetMaxIdleConns.
DB.title:
DB is a database handle representing a pool of zero or more
underlying connections. It's safe for concurrent use by multiple
goroutines.

GetPlanParams.description: required for swaggered, otherwise never used

GetUserPlansParams.description: required for swaggered, otherwise never used

email.description:
Required. Backend code does not check email atm.
in: body

password.description:
Required. Backend code does not have any password requirements atm.
in: body

remember.description:
Optional. Return refresh token in response
in: body

activeCurrencyBalance.description:
Required for the root order of the tree. Child orders for tree may or may not have a currencyBalance.
in: body

grupo.description:
Optional group of order
in: body

keyID.description:
Required this is our api key ID (string uuid) assigned to the user's exchange key and secret.
in: body

limitPrice.description:
Required for 'limit' orders. Defines limit price.
in: body

marketName.description:
Required e.g. ADA-BTC. Base pair should be the suffix.
in: body

orderID.description:
Required the client assigns the order ID as a UUID, the format is 8-4-4-4-12.
in: body

orderPriority.description:
Optional precedence of orders when multiple orders are at the same depth: value of 1 is highest priority. E.g. depth 2 buy ADA (1) or buy EOS (2). ADA with higher priority 1 will execute and EOS will not execute.
in: body

orderTemplateID.description:
Optional order template ID.
in: body

orderType.description:
Required order types are "market", "limit", "paper". Orders not within these types will be rejected.
in: body

parentOrderID.description:
Required the root node of the decision tree should be assigned a parentOrderID of "00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000" .
in: body

triggers.description:
Required these are the conditions that trigger the order to execute: ???
in: body

Plan.description: This response should never return the key secret

closeOnComplete.description:
Required bool to indicate that you want the plan to be 'closed' when the last order for the plan finishes (note: order status fail will also close the plan)
in: body

orders.description:
Required array of orders. The structure of the order tree will be dictated by the parentOrderID. All orders following the root order must have a parentOrderID. The root order must have a parentOrderID of "00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000". Use grupo (aka spanish for group) to assign a group label to orders.
in: body

planTemplateID.description:
Optional plan template ID.
in: body

status.description:
Optional defaults to 'active' status. Valid input status is 'active', 'inactive', or 'historic'
in: body
